title: What possibly can be done?
question: my mother passed 2002, she had a will, (my brother held on to it for 14 years, i never knew about my mother's will until my stepfather passed 2016), the girlfriend of my stepfather changed all information on all accounts including my mother's company. On the bank statements, it says my stepfather was owner with my mother's name nowhere on it. The will looked like it had been tampered with, it's not my mother's writing. On my stepfather's death certificate, it states he is a pipe fitter, on my mother's death certificate, it states she is self employed, owner of identification. They had put joint owner on all accounts and co- owner on a primary linked account on an that legal order processing said belongs to us but that is not what the bank told my sister and i. The bank told us there is a primary linked account in your mother's name that belongs to her children. Not soon after that, the administrators bank manager wrote the court saying that account had a co- owner and that it was a joint account. How can I get my mother's bank statements from the time she first opened them.?
answers:
Too many questions and too little information provided.
Review all documents and facts with probate counsel to assess rights and options.
Find an attorney to use all legal remedies. You are in over your head if you want to pursue anything and it will need to be done through the courts. There is no magic wand.

It's unclear how your mother's estate got probated without this Will and why it's involved in your stepfather's estate.

Your stepfather presumably inherited her bank accounts because if he was married to her at the time of her death, he'd already own 1/2 as his community property share, and he'd inherit her share at her death. But maybe there are payable on death designations for you and your sister and your brother.

It's not clear what court proceeding you're referring to. You need to hire your own probate lawyer to look into your mother's death as well as your stepfather's.
